alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 6:09PM MST until January 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW OVER THE PLAINS... .Snow, heavy at times, will continue over the plains through midnight and then slowly decrease. Further west along the I-25 Corridor and across the higher terrain light snow will continue this evening before ending around midnight. Some light freezing drizzle may occur at lower elevations. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow ongoing with light freezing drizzle. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, The Southern Front Range Foothills, Boulder and the western suburbs of Denver, Denver, and Castle Rock. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
